name: Robot Kinematics and Dynamics

prereqs.text: (15-122 [] at least C) or (16-311 [] at least D) or (24-311 [] at least D) or (21-241 [] at least D) or (18-202 [] at least D)

long_desc: Foundations and principles of robotic kinematics. Topics include transformations, forward kinematics, inverse kinematics, differential kinematics Jacobians,  manipulability, and basic equations of motion. Course also include programming on robot arms.

custom_fields.goals: to learn and then implement the key topics in transformation, forward kinematics, inverse kinematics, differential kinematics Jacobians, statics, dynamics
custom_fields.key_topics: transformation, forward kinematics, inverse kinematics, differential kinematics (Jacobians), statics, dynamics
custom_fields.relevance: kinematics and dynamics of robots are critical to understand how to design and program robots
custom_fields.learning_resources: Two modular robot arms in an educational robotics lab
